page.title: 14FARM MACHINERY & MILKPARLOUR
page.content: The Massey Ferguson machinery includes haybalers;two tractors;muckspreaders; haybob,which turns the hay;the forage harvester, which transfers the grass to the trailer;the slurry auger,which sucks up the slurry to load it into the spreader.They use diesel engines. The cows are milked at 6am and 4pm. While the cows are being milked they are fed cow cake.10 cows can go into the parlour at one time,but only 5 can be milked.A group of 6 tubes (cluster) is placed on the cow's teats and the milk is sucked into a glass collecting jar(which has a 30 litre capacity). A pipe takes the milk from the jar into the bulk tank(which has a 1400 litre capacity). This is collected at about 9am by road tanker and taken to Well- ington Dairy. 810 litres of milk are produced daily in Summer and 1100 litres in Winter.
